title.narrative: ADB Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility
ADB Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility

description.narrative: CEFs huvudsakliga mål är att finansiera projekt inom "ren Energi", dvs. förnybart, energieff, och tillgång till energi. Fonden finansierar även pilotprojekt, utveckling av policy, finansieringsmetoder etc. för att stimulere ren energi.

Clean Energy Fund is part of ADB Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility. Main objective to finance projects in clean energy, major demonstration projects, policy development and mode of fundings.

The Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility (CEFPF) was established in 2007 to help improve energy security in Developing Member Countries (DMCs) and decrease the rate of climate change. It will do this by financing the deployment of new, more efficient and less polluting supply and end-use technologies, through either grant or non-grant resources. The CEFPF is composed of the Clean Energy Fund (CEF), the Asian Clean Energy Fund (ACEF), the Carbon Capture and Storage Fund (CCSF) and the Canadian Climate Fund for the Private Sector in Asia (CFPS).

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

tag.narrative: 13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
7.1 - By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
7.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa allmän tillgång till ekonomiskt överkomliga, tillförlitliga och moderna energitjänster.

7.a - By 2030, enhance international cooperation to facilitate access to clean energy research and technology, including renewable energy, energy efficiency and advanced and cleaner fossil-fuel technology, and promote investment in energy infrastructure and clean energy technology.

7.a - Till 2030 stärka det internationella samarbetet för att underlätta tillgång till forskning och teknik inom ren energi, inklusive förnybar energi, energieffektivitet samt avancerad och renare fossilbränslebaserad teknik, samt främja investeringar i energiinfrastruktur och ren energiteknik.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The CEFPF's performance measure against the target outcome at the completion of all projects in its portfolio. To date, the combined support of the CEFPF and Climate Change Fund Clean Energy Component (CCF-CE) have surpassed the (two) outcome level targets for carbon dioxide (CO2) emission reduction (27.1 million tons of CO2 emission reduction/year attained vs. target of 20.0 million of CO2 emission reduction/year) and energy savings (18.7 terra-watt hour-equivalent/year of energy savings attained vs. target of 18.0 TWh-eq/year). The installed renewable energy capacity reached 2,329.8 mega-watt (MW) which is 67% achievement rate of the 3,500 MW target. Meanwhile, the renewable energy generation reached 7.4 TWh/year which is 74% achievement rate of the 10 TWh/year target.
In terms of outputs level indicators, 12 out of the 16 indicators are progressing well and have achieved at least 75% of the target. There are 4 output indicators that require significant work which include households provided with access to energy in participating developing member countries (DMCs) supported, households connected to modern fuels and/or efficient devices for heating, households connected to modern fuels and/or efficient devices for cooking, and carbon capture and storage demonstration projects.
Gender aspects is related to the output - Benefits from access to energy delivered. To date, CEFPF has supported 36 projects with access to energy components that will benefit 392,887 households provided with energy access. This number falls short of the target 700,000 household, which illustrates the difficulty encountered by the CEFPF in attracting access to energy projects. The CEFPF also supports projects that improve women access to energy, social services, economic and financial resources and opportunities, and contribute to gender equality and women empowerment. To date, 82% (of target 80%) of projects with access to energy component contribute to the improvement Results Framework of women energy access.
The CEFPF will continue the multi-sector approach including sectors such as transport, agriculture, water and education sectors that are likely to integrate more clean renewable energy solutions into project design and development.
In energy sector, the ADB is addressing the impact of CVOID-19 through projects. For example, the outbreak of the Coronavirus disease has raised concerns on the transmission of viruses through centralized air conditioning (CAC) systems. In many ADB's Developing Member Countries (DMCs), the risk of transmission in CAC systems is higher because of inadequate hygiene standards. Toward this, the CEFPF co-financed a Knowledge and Support Technical Assistance (KSTA) to support DMCs mitigate the risks of virus transmission and ensure safe working conditions in public buildings by deploying efficient, clean, and smart CAC systems. It is envisioned that pilot systems will demonstrate the effectively of the technology and be taken up by the DMCs to mitigate the risk of COVID-19 and other transmittable diseases.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
